Active Data Context.description:
Can be placed anywhere that script tags are valid.

Should only be in one template used to render a page.

Active Data Head.description: Allows collection of active data from pages with a <head> tag.

Analytics Off.description:
Disables analytics for single pages.

Can be placed anywhere that script tags are valid.

Cache.description:
Can be placed anywhere in the template.
However, as a best practice, Commerce Cloud recommends that caching statements are placed at the beginning of a template.

If the tag occurs several times in one template, the one set to cache off or the one with the shortest cache time is used as the cache setting for the resulting page.

Comment.description:
Can be placed anywhere in the template.
Using <iscomment> is preferable to using HTML comments, especially for sensitive information, because the tag is removed automatically by B2C Commerce on rendered pages.

Component.description: Including the output of a pipeline in the page.

Content.description:
Define the MIME type of the output document.
Location: Before the HTML DOCTYPE declaration.

To make sure all characters in a document are correctly encoded, the <iscontent/> tag should always be first in an ISML template.

Don't specify <iscontent> if it isn't needed. The default for pipeline responses text/html, UTF-8, and compact="false".

The default for emails when using the SendMail pipelet is text/plain.

Continue.description:
Jump to the beginning of the loop.

Only used inside <isloop>...</isloop>.

Decorate.description:
Template decoration mechanism.
Must wrap all content to be decorated.

For <isdecorate> to render a page, the content it wraps must contain an <isreplace/> tag.

Else Condition.description:
Specifying what happens if a condition doesn't evaluate to true.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Else If Condition.description:
Creating conditional template code.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

If Condition.description:
Creating conditional template code.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Ife Condition.description:
Creating conditional template code.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Include.description:
Including the contents of one template inside another.
Can be placed anywhere in the template.

However, as a best practice, add includes that affect the whole page to the top of the template.

Loop.body:
<isloop items="${$1item_object}" var="var_name" status="var_name" begin="${expression}" end="${expression}" step="${expression}">
</isloop>
Loop.description:
Creating loops.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Module.description:
Declaring custom tags.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

In SiteGenesis, all <ismodules> are declared in one file: util/modules.isml.

Next.description:
Jumping forward within a loop.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Only used inside <isloop>...</isloop>.

Object ISML.description:
Collects page impressions or views from the storefront.

Must wrap any object you want to record active data for.

Redirect.description:
Redirecting browsers to specific URLs.

Location: Before the HTML DOCTYPE declaration.

Remove.description:
Removing user-defined variables.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Replace.description:
Part of the decorator mechanism; insert content to be decorated.

Must be within <isdecorate> tags. If a template is going to be remotely included, the <isdecorate> tags can be in the including template.

Script ISML.description:
Creating scripts within templates.

Can be placed anywhere that script tags are valid.

Select ISML.body: <isselect name="$1simple_name" iterator="${loop_var}" description="description" value="text_value" condition="true|false" encoding="on|off"/>$0
Select ISML.description:
Enhancements to the HTML<select> tag.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Set.description:
Setting user-defined variables.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.

Slot.description:
Define slots for content display.

Location: Usually within <isdecorate> tags.

Status.description:
Define status codes.

Can be placed anywhere in the template.
